jobs.title: Infection Control Preventionist
jobs.description:
Part time

Non-exempt


POSITION SUMMARY 

Provides surveillance of Hospital inpatient population for evidence of infection. Assists Nursing personnel in proper care of infected patients, including isolation procedures when indicated. Establishes and maintains a program of infection control training for Hospital personnel. Collects and compiles data on numbers and types of infections. Coordinates the infection control process to achieve compliance with state and other regulatory standards. Maintains oversight and administration of the Hospital’s Respiratory Protection Program.


Position Summary Expanded:

Under the Oklahoma Medical Marijuana and Patient Protection Act, (“The Unity Bill”) this position is considered a “Safety-sensitive position. “Safety-sensitive” is defined to include “any job that includes tasks or duties that could affect the safety and health of the employee performing the task or others.” Employees working in “safety-sensitive” roles are subject to this exception and subject to disciplinary action in the event of a positive test for marijuana or its metabolites.


SUPERVISOR

Chief Clinical Officer (CCO)


Job Functions

1) Serves as principal working member of the Infection Control committee.

2) Responsible for influencing, coordinating, implementing, supervising, and evaluating the standards of care developed by the Committee.

3) Conducts ongoing surveillance of infections in hospital patients and hospital personnel. Compiles and interprets the surveillance data. 

4) Investigates clusters of infections or changes in patterns of infection. 

5) Communicates data regarding hospital-related infections with appropriate department heads and works collaboratively with other departments to seek solutions to infection problems. 

6) Collaborates with all disciplines and departments in Hospital to incorporate infection control principles in policies and procedures in order to provide a safe environment for hospital patients and personnel. 

7) Continues self-education by reviewing current literature and attending workshops and formal courses. 

8) Report infections and/or communicable diseases to appropriate public health authority. 

9) Develops and updates isolation techniques according to current standards of practice to provide optimum care to patients with infections and provide protection for employees. 

10) Develops and presents in-service education programs on prevention and control of infection for hospital personnel. Acts as resource to hospital personnel on relation matters in conjunction with the Medical Staff. 

11) Monitors patient care activities to identify methods, techniques, equipment, supplies, products, procedures, and policies which could constitute a risk of originating or transmitting infection.

12) Orients new hospital employees to Infection Control/Employee Health Program used in the Hospital.

13) Performs crisis intervention/follow-p for relating to potential exposure to infectious diseases by employees and patients.

14) Conducts surveillance of significant infections/health problems of employees. 

15) Maintains established departmental policies and procedures.

16) Performs other associated duties as directed by Director and/or Administration.

17) Demonstrates knowledge of disaster/emergency procedures and responds appropriately in emergency situations.

18) Maintains oversight and administration of the Hospital’s Respiratory Protection Program.

19) Demonstrates initiative in personal/professional development.
jobs.requirements:
EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE 

Graduate of an accredited school of nursing

Knowledge of theory, principles, techniques, and practice of professional nursing; of scientific principles and nursing research; of preparation, administration, and action of medications; of treatments and medical procedures; of counseling and teaching techniques; of medical equipment as it relates to patient care.  

Working knowledge of aseptic techniques, prevention of control of infection, and principles of microbiology and epidemiology. 

Ability to operate and handle many kinds of complex equipment.   

Ability to demonstrate clinical competence and maintain current knowledge in caring for pediatric through geriatric patients. 

Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing on all levels. 

**Required educational levels call for proof at time of hire.

Minimum 5 years previous nursing experience.

Emergency Room experience preferred. 

Demonstrate leadership qualities, self-directed and willing to assume decision-making responsibilities.


LICENSURE/CERTIFICATION

Licensed as a Registered Nurse in the state of Oklahoma

BLS and ACLS required upon hire

PALS required within 90-days of employment

*Proof of all required License(s) and Certification(s) is due at time of hire.

jobs.title: COOK & DIETARY AIDE
jobs.description:
POSITION SUMMARY 


The cook/aide is responsible for preparing palatable, nourishing, well-balanced meals to meet the daily nutritional and special dietary needs for patients and/or residents. This position is responsible for the cleanliness and sanitation of the cooking area and stoves; and for preparing, operating, and maintaining all cooking equipment. This position is also responsible for preparing meals for patients’ families, employees and guest within the facility.


SUPERVISOR

Food Service Supervisor 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each key function satisfactorily.
  • Each category will be assessed on performance measurements of appropriateness, efficiency, effectiveness, and timeliness. 
  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the key functions.


Job Functions

1) Prepares, maintains and ensures high quality food for consumption in accordance with predesigned recipes based on appropriate patient dietary restrictions and/or cafeteria menu.

2) Maintains and handles food with highest concern toward safe handling and sanitation. 


3) Check patient diet cards and prepare food accordingly.

4) Cover, label and date all left over foods. Make plan for use of these foods.

5) Reviews menu daily to determine quantities of food and supply need for stock and reserve purposes.

6) Reports and food substitutions, deviations or shortages to appropriate personnel.


7) Ensures equipment is in good working condition and work area is maintained in a clean and sanitized state. Report any malfunctions immediately.

8) Monitors and documents food/equipment temperatures as appropriate. 

9) Adapts to changing environment, e.g., staffing patterns and assignments. Required to work holidays and subject to adjusted patient census schedule. 

10) Take on additional tasks as needed and directed by the Dietary Supervisor, Dietitian, or Administration.


ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Comply with HIPAA regulatory requirements. 
  • Adhere to the hospital’s philosophy, mission, and policies and procedures.
  • Maintains a good attendance record.
  • Adhere to dress code. 
  • Establishes and maintains excellent interdepartmental and interpersonal relationships.
jobs.requirements:
POSITION QUALIFICATIONS


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to work both independently and cooperatively with team.  
  • Ability to follow simple direction or instruction. 


EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE  

  • High school graduate or equivalency.
  • One year of experience working in a kitchen setting preferred.  


LANGUAGE SKILLS

  • English is the primary language. 


MATHEMATICAL SKILLS

  • Ability to use food conversion formulas as needed.

jobs.title: HOUSE SHIFT SUPERVISOR
jobs.description:
POSITION SUMMARY 

The House Shift Supervisor is responsible for the direct and indirect nursing care of all patients experiencing medically complex conditions, and with rehabilitation and/or wound care needs. He/she is also responsible for the overall direction and supervision of all nursing department personnel during his/her shift. Demonstrates the knowledge and skill to carry out the nursing process when providing care, treatment and services to patients. Satisfies the established standards of the nursing practice, supervises, delegates, and coordinates personnel assigned to the unit and patient care. Supervises the interdisciplinary value-focused care management system and assessed outcomes. Teamwork is promoted between physicians and personnel of other departments.

.


Position Summary Expanded:


Under the Oklahoma Medical Marijuana and Patient Protection Act, (“The Unity Bill”) this position is considered a “Safety-sensitive position. “Safety-sensitive” is defined to include “any job that includes tasks or duties that could affect the safety and health of the employee performing the task or others.” Employees working in “safety-sensitive” roles are subject to this exception and subject to disciplinary action in the event of a positive test for marijuana or its metabolites.



SUPERVISOR

  • CCO


POSITION SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

Supervisory Positions may include:


0 Registered Nurse 0 License Vocational Nurse or Licensed Practical Nurse

0 Certified Nursing Assistant 0 Nurse Technician

0 Monitor Tech 0 Unit Secretary.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each key function satisfactorily.
  • Each category will be assessed on performance measurements of appropriateness, efficiency, effectiveness, and timeliness. 
  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the key functions. 








Job Function

Supervises, coordinates and delegates the delivery of care, treatment and services provided by selected members of the healthcare team. Assesses the value risks, (clinical, perceptual and financial), to minimize the potential impact.  

Communicates directly with patients, families, medical staff, nursing staff, interdisciplinary team members and department heads to coordinate care, treatment and services, improve organization and implementation of patient care to maintain quality of care. Evaluates patient outcomes and revises plan according to changes in patient needs.  

Conducts performance improvement activities to monitor performance and to continuously improve quality. Participates in gathering and analyzing data for trends and to institute actions to resolve problems promptly.

Develops a comprehensive plan of care and discharge plan based on the nursing assessment and integration of the medical plan utilizing patient’s family and other health care tam members. Communicates effectively and appropriate to patient, family and other health care providers.

Assess patient’s condition, learning needs and family dynamics based on systematic data collection utilizing assessment skills and tools appropriate to the respective practice area. 

Document timely and accurately the delivery of health care and nursing process in accordance with specific unit standards and hospital nursing policy. 

Maintains clinical competency (to include age specific) by assuming responsib8ilty for acquiring knowledge and experiences and integrate, as appropriate, into patient care delivery based upon specific patient needs. 

Participates in orientation and education of personnel and students

Access to Pharmacy after hours as required by law. Access limited to following safeguards: 1)successfully completed training and competency provided by Pharmacist 2)access is limited to a set of medications approved by MEC 3) Obtain two (2) signatures upon entry; a pharmacist and an RN and 4) Pharmacist will be available 24 hours a day to answer questions or review medications.   


ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Ability to carry out the essential functions of this job (with or without reasonable accommodation).
  • Access continuing education opportunities appropriate to responsibilities.
  • Accountable for leadership of staff as assigned, delegating and coordinating nursing care to achieve and measure quality, cost-effective outcomes
  • Checks emergency equipment 
  • Demonstrates competency in operation of critical care equipment
  • Demonstrates critical thinking skills 
  • Demonstrates procedures related to the use of nursing equipment and supplies.
  • Demonstrates respect for co-workers and responds to needs of patients by complying with hospital policies.
  • Knows the rationale for the effect of medications and treatments and correctly administer same.
  • Maintains a safe and effective environment.
  • Makes patient rounds to assess physical and emotional status and to initiate nursing intervention.
  • Obtains report from nurse being relieved from duty and provides report to nurse coming on duty. Keeps Nursing Unit manager or others as appropriate informed about patient’s status and related matters. Performs or supervises complete, timely, and accurate documentation of patient care.
  • Performs or supervises administration and documentation of medications, internal nutrition and treatments per physician’s order and accurately records all care provided.
  • Performs or supervises review of medication and treatment records for completeness, accuracy in transcription of physician orders and adherence to stop order policy.
  • Responds to patient and family concern, ensures that each concern is documented and a resolution is initiated. 
  • Responsible for planning, organizing and evaluating care interventions and their effect on outcome
  • Seeks out external resources through conferences, workshops, etc. as necessary. Shares professional knowledge with staff, managers and hospital personnel 
  • Supports staff, patient and family education to enhance knowledge, skills, and necessary behaviors to facilitate positive outcomes.  
  • Utilizes the nursing process, documentation, communication and technical skills, collaboration with physicians and other team members to meet performance requirements
  • Promote the philosophy, mission and objectives of the Company within and to customers outside the hospital.
  • Demonstrates satisfactory level of interpersonal skills to interact with facility and medical staff and Administration, patients, families customers, vendors and government agencies.
  • Assure participation in relevant in-service training sessions, facility meetings and continuing educational opportunities appropriate to responsibilities.   
  • Demonstrates honesty and integrity at all times in care and use of patient and hospital property.
  • Demonstrates ability to prioritize tasks/responsibilities and compete duties within allotted time.  
  • Appropriately accesses the resources of the company’s corporate offices for consultation and program development support. Seeks out external resources through conferences, workshops, etc. as necessary. Shares professional knowledge with staff, directors, managers and hospital personnel.
  • Participate in hospital wide patient safety program identifying risks to patient safety and reducing healthcare errors.
  • Comply with HIPAA regulatory requirements. 
  • Perform other duties as assigned
jobs.requirements:
POSITION QUALIFICATIONS


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Ability to project a Professional Image.
  • Knowledge of regulatory standards, compliance requirements and hospital policies and procedures.
  • Working knowledge and ability to apply professional standards of practice in job situations.
  • Strong organizational and analytical skills.
  • Working knowledge of computer and software applications used in job functions. (Order entry, data entry).
  • Persons who have been found guilty by a court of law of abusing, neglecting, or mistreating individuals in a health care related setting are ineligible for employment in this position.
  • Freedom from illegal use of drugs.
  • Freedom from use of and effects of use of drugs and alcohol in the workplace


EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE 

  • Graduate from an accredited school of professional nursing.   
  • Prefer a Registered Nurse with supervisory experience in long-term acute care or geriatric nursing. Two or more years’ experience as a RN in acute care is preferred.  
  • Completed competency for entry into Drug Room after hours


LICENSURE/CERTIFICATION

  • Registered Nurse who is currently licensed to practice, in good standing, by the state of employment.  
  • BLS, PALS and ACLS required upon hire certifications 
  • *Proof of all required License(s) and Certification(s) is due at time of hire.


LANGUAGE SKILLS

  • English is the primary language 
  • Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures or governmental regulations. 
  • Ability to interpret and write reports, business correspondence, and policy/procedure manuals. 
  • Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, physicians, clients, customers, employees, the board and the public. 


MATHEMATICAL SKILLS

  • Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals.  
  • Ability to compute ratio, percent, rate, as well as the ability to create and interpret graphs. 


REASONING ABILITY 

  • Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instruction furnished in written, oral, and/or diagram form.  
  • Ability to define and solve problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. 
  • Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in statistical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. 

INTERPERSONAL SKILLS

  • Demonstrates active listening techniques.
  • Gains support through effective relationships.
  • Treats others with dignity and respect; seeks feedback. 
  • Demonstrates honesty and integrity at all times in care and use of patient and hospital property. 
  • Demonstrates and understands the importance of and respect for the rights, dignity and individuality of each patient in all interactions. 
  • Demonstrates respect for co-workers and responds to the needs of patients by complying with hospital policies.

jobs.title: CERTIFIED NURSE ASSISTANT
jobs.description:
POSITION SUMMARY 

Assist licensed nursing personnel in providing patient care in assigned areas. Helps patients by supporting personal hygiene and daily living needs; providing comfort, transportation, and vital sign monitoring.


Position Summary Expanded:


Under the Oklahoma Medical Marijuana and Patient Protection Act, (“The Unity Bill”) this position is considered a “Safety-sensitive position. “Safety-sensitive” is defined to include “any job that includes tasks or duties that could affect the safety and health of the employee performing the task or others.” Employees working in “safety-sensitive” roles are subject to this exception and subject to disciplinary action in the event of a positive test for marijuana or its metabolites.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each key function satisfactorily.
  • Each category will be assessed on performance measurements of appropriateness, efficiency, effectiveness, and timeliness. 
  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the key functions. 



Job Functions


1) Responsible for feeding patients (some patients will require direct feeding, while others may just need their meal tray brought to them and set up).


2) Provides oral care, nail care and basic hygiene for patients. 

3) Responsible for bathing and dressing of patients. Bathing may take the place in the form of a bed bath, shower, or tub. 


4) Responsible for helping patients to the restroom when needed. Often patients will need help moving on and off the toilet or bed pan. 


5) Changing of catheter bags and charting amounts

6) Blood pressure, pulse, pulse oximetry, and temperature monitoring of patients. 

7) Answering call lights.

8) Turning of bedridden patients. This is done to take the weight off of pressure points and prevent bedsores from occurring.


9) Changing bedding and collecting soiled laundry.

10) Light cleaning and organizing of patient room or area.

11) Relaying and charting requested information. This may include moods, vital signs, meal consumption, liquid intake, and daily bowel movement and urine amounts. 


12) Relaying information to the next CNA on shift, or to the nurses in charge.

13) Recreational activities, such as assisting with a walk outdoors or delivering reading material to patients. 


14) Post mortem care. 

15) Provides safe and effective nursing care rendered directly or indirectly. 

16) Courteous to all members of the hospital staff.

17) Communicates with all members of the healthcare team. 

18) Certified to perform cardio-pulmonary resuscitation (CPR) and be knowledgeable of all critical access hospital emergency protocols. (OHA 310:667-39-9 e.7)


19) Perform other duties as assigned. 


ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Comply with HIPAA regulatory requirements. 
  • Adhere to the companies/facilities philosophy, mission, and policies and procedures.
  • Support the facility goals and objectives.
  • Maintains a good attendance record and follows all hospital rules, policies and procedures.
  • Maintains open and effective communications with patients and their nurses, physicians, peers, supervisors, and students. Establishes and maintains excellent interdepartmental and interpersonal relationships.
  • Attends departmental meetings and in-services to stay current with the developments of the department and hospital.
  • Observes that proper safety measures are enforced in the techniques used on patients receiving therapy. Maintains high safety standards in the facility.
jobs.requirements:
POSITION QUALIFICATIONS


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Certified as a CNA in the state of Oklahoma.
  • BLS certification required within 90 days of employment.
  • Demonstrates initiative, ability to work with others, and professional judgement.  


EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE 

  • Ability to operate and handle many kinds of complex equipment.   
  • Ability to demonstrate clinical competence and maintain current knowledge in caring for pediatric through geriatric patients. 
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing. 
  • Required educational levels call for proof at time of hire.
  • 2 years previous hospital experience preferred.


LICENSURE/CERTIFICATION

  • Certified as a Nurse Aide (CNA) in the state of Oklahoma.
  • BLS certified.
  • Proof of all required License(s) and Certification(s) is due at time of hire.


LANGUAGE SKILLS

  • English is the primary language.
  • Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures or governmental regulations. 
  • Ability to interpret reports, business correspondence, and policy/procedure manuals. 
  • Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, physicians, clients, customers, employees, and the public. 


MATHEMATICAL SKILLS

  • Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals.  


REASONING ABILITY 

  • Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instruction furnished in written, oral, and/or diagram form.  
  • Ability to define and solve problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. 

INTERPERSONAL SKILLS

  • Demonstrates active listening techniques.
  • Gains support through effective relationships.
  • Treats others with dignity and respect; seeks feedback. 
  • Demonstrates honesty and integrity at all times in care and use of patient and facility property. 
  • Demonstrates and understands the importance of and respect for the rights, dignity, and individuality of each patient in all interactions. 
  • Demonstrates respect for co-workers and responds to the needs of patients by complying with facility policies.

jobs.title: REGISTERED NURSE
jobs.description:
POSITION SUMMARY 

A clinically competent Registered Nurse who coordinates and delivers professional nursing care to the acutely ill patient in all phases of life (newborn through geriatric) using the nursing process of assessment, planning, implementation, and evaluation. Effectively interacts with the patient, significant other(s), and other health team members while maintaining the standards of professional nursing.


Position Summary Expanded:


Under the Oklahoma Medical Marijuana and Patient Protection Act, (“The Unity Bill”) this position is considered a “Safety-sensitive position. “Safety-sensitive” is defined to include “any job that includes tasks or duties that could affect the safety and health of the employee performing the task or others.” Employees working in “safety-sensitive” roles are subject to this exception and subject to disciplinary action in the event of a positive test for marijuana or its metabolites.



SUPERVISOR

Hospital Chief Clinical Officer (CCO)


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each key function satisfactorily.
  • Each category will be assessed on performance measurements of appropriateness, efficiency, effectiveness, and timeliness. 
  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the key functions. 


Job Functions


1) Provides direct patient care. Acts as a patient advocate.

2) Assumes responsibility and accountability for individual knowledge, skill, performance and behavior in accordance with unit standards of care.

3) Maintains patient, employee, physician and corporate confidentiality, and respects the rights, privacy, and property of others.

4) Demonstrates compliance with infection control guidelines hospital safety management program, including proper use of personal protective equipment.

5) Ensures nursing care data is accurately documented in the patient care record.

6) Provides patients, families, significant others with relevant health care education, instructions, and discharge planning.

7) Maintains current competency in his/her specialty, including, but not limited to, those practices as outlined in the nursing competency program.

8) Provides leadership/supervision to staff members and others assigned to the care of his/her patients.

9) Assigns patient care responsibilities to members of the nursing staff.

10) Collaborates effectively with patients, families, significant others, nurses, physicians, and other members of the health care team.

11) Participates in the review/revision of nursing policies, procedures, standards of patient care and standards of nursing practices.

12) Participates in the process of monitoring and evaluating the quality of care provided.

13) Consistently presents a professional image and a caring attitude.

14) Provides safe and effective nursing care to patients through the use of the nursing process.

15) Exercises appropriate judgement and correct techniques in the performance of procedures, treatments, and drug administration.

16) Utilizes measures to promote patient, visitor, and personnel safety.

17) Demonstrates knowledge of disaster/emergency procedures and responds appropriately in emergency situations.

18) Demonstrates initiative in personal/professional development.


ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Seek out external resources through conferences, workshops, etc. as necessary. 
  • Share professional knowledge with hospital staff, board members, and administrator.
  • Comply with HIPAA regulatory requirements. 
  • Adhere to the companies/facilities philosophy, mission, and policies and procedures.
  • Support the facility goals and objectives.
  • Maintains a good attendance record and follows all hospital rules, policies and procedures.
  • Maintains open and effective communications with patients and their nurses, physicians, peers, supervisors, and students. Establishes and maintains excellent interdepartmental and interpersonal relationships.
  • Attends departmental meetings and in-services to stay current with the developments of the department and hospital.
  • Observes that proper safety measures are enforced in the techniques used on patients receiving therapy. Maintains high safety standards in the facility.
jobs.requirements:
POSITION QUALIFICATIONS


Minimum Qualifications

  • BLS, ACLS and PALS certification required upon hire and throughout employment. 
  • Demonstrates initiative, ability to work with others, and professional judgement.  


EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE 

  • Knowledge of theory, principles, techniques, and practice of professional nursing; of scientific principles and nursing research; of preparation, administration, and action of medications; of treatments and medical procedures; of counseling and teaching techniques; of medical equipment as it relates to patient care.  
  • Ability to operate and handle many kinds of complex equipment.   
  • Ability to demonstrate clinical competence and maintain current knowledge in caring for pediatric through geriatric patients. 
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing. 
  • **Required educational levels call for proof at time of hire.
  • 2 years previous hospital experience preferred.
  • Emergency Room experience preferred. 


LICENSURE/CERTIFICATION

  • Licensed as a Registered Nurse in the state of Oklahoma
  • BLS, ACLS and PALS certification required upon hire and throughout employment. 
  • *Proof of all required License(s) and Certification(s) is due at time of hire.


LANGUAGE SKILLS

  • English is the primary language 
  • Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures or governmental regulations. 
  • Ability to interpret reports, business correspondence, and policy/procedure manuals. 
  • Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, physicians, clients, customers, employees, and the public. 


MATHEMATICAL SKILLS

  • Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals.  
  • Ability to compute ratio, percent, rate, as well as the ability to create and interpret graphs. 


REASONING ABILITY 

  • Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instruction furnished in written, oral, and/or diagram form.  
  • Ability to define and solve problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. 
  • Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in statistical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. 

INTERPERSONAL SKILLS

  • Demonstrates active listening techniques.
  • Gains support through effective relationships.
  • Treats others with dignity and respect; seeks feedback. 
  • Demonstrates honesty and integrity at all times in care and use of patient and hospital property. 
  • Demonstrates and understands the importance of and respect for the rights, dignity and individuality of each patient in all interactions. 
  • Demonstrates respect for co-workers and responds to the needs of patients by complying with hospital policies.

  • Attends departmental meetings and in-services to stay current with the developments of the department and hospital.

  • Ability to interpret reports, business correspondence, and policy/procedure manuals. 
  • Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, physicians, clients, customers, employees, and the public. 


MATHEMATICAL SKILLS

  • Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals.  
  • Ability to compute ratio, percent, rate, as well as the ability to create and interpret graphs. 


REASONING ABILITY 

  • Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instruction furnished in written, oral, and/or diagram form.  
  • Ability to define and solve problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. 
  • Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in statistical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. 

INTERPERSONAL SKILLS

  • Demonstrates active listening techniques.
  • Gains support through effective relationships.
  • Treats others with dignity and respect; seeks feedback. 
  • Demonstrates honesty and integrity at all times in care and use of patient and hospital property. 
  • Demonstrates and understands the importance of and respect for the rights, dignity and individuality of each patient in all interactions. 
  • Demonstrates respect for co-workers and responds to the needs of patients by complying with hospital policies.

jobs.title: COOK & DIETARY AIDE
jobs.description:
POSITION SUMMARY 


The cook/aide is responsible for preparing palatable, nourishing, well-balanced meals to meet the daily nutritional and special dietary needs for patients and/or residents. This position is responsible for the cleanliness and sanitation of the cooking area and stoves; and for preparing, operating, and maintaining all cooking equipment. This position is also responsible for preparing meals for patients’ families, employees and guest within the facility.


SUPERVISOR

Food Service Supervisor 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each key function satisfactorily.
  • Each category will be assessed on performance measurements of appropriateness, efficiency, effectiveness, and timeliness. 
  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the key functions.


Job Functions

1) Prepares, maintains and ensures high quality food for consumption in accordance with predesigned recipes based on appropriate patient dietary restrictions and/or cafeteria menu.

2) Maintains and handles food with highest concern toward safe handling and sanitation. 


3) Check patient diet cards and prepare food accordingly.

4) Cover, label and date all left over foods. Make plan for use of these foods.

5) Reviews menu daily to determine quantities of food and supply need for stock and reserve purposes.

6) Reports and food substitutions, deviations or shortages to appropriate personnel.


7) Ensures equipment is in good working condition and work area is maintained in a clean and sanitized state. Report any malfunctions immediately.

8) Monitors and documents food/equipment temperatures as appropriate. 

9) Adapts to changing environment, e.g., staffing patterns and assignments. Required to work holidays and subject to adjusted patient census schedule. 

10) Take on additional tasks as needed and directed by the Dietary Supervisor, Dietitian, or Administration.


ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Comply with HIPAA regulatory requirements. 
  • Adhere to the hospital’s philosophy, mission, and policies and procedures.
  • Maintains a good attendance record.
  • Adhere to dress code. 
  • Establishes and maintains excellent interdepartmental and interpersonal relationships.
jobs.requirements:
POSITION QUALIFICATIONS


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to work both independently and cooperatively with team.  
  • Ability to follow simple direction or instruction. 


EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE  

  • High school graduate or equivalency.
  • One year of experience working in a kitchen setting preferred.  


LANGUAGE SKILLS

  • English is the primary language. 


MATHEMATICAL SKILLS

  • Ability to use food conversion formulas as needed.

jobs.title: LICENSED PRACTICAL NURSE
jobs.description:
POSITION SUMMARY 

A clinically competent Licensed Practical Nurse who coordinates and delivers professional nursing care to the acutely ill patient in all phases of life (newborn through geriatric) using the nursing process of assessment, planning, implementation, and evaluation. Effectively interacts with the patient, significant other(s), and other health team members while maintaining the standards of professional nursing. Responsible for assisting physicians/providers, patient preparation and basic screening procedures, to assure efficient patient flow in clinic.

 

Position Summary Expanded:


Under the Oklahoma Medical Marijuana and Patient Protection Act, (“The Unity Bill”) this position is considered a “Safety-sensitive position. “Safety-sensitive” is defined to include “any job that includes tasks or duties that could affect the safety and health of the employee performing the task or others.” Employees working in “safety-sensitive” roles are subject to this exception and subject to disciplinary action in the event of a positive test for marijuana or its metabolites.



SUPERVISOR

Chief Clinical Officer

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each key function satisfactorily.
  • Each category will be assessed on performance measurements of appropriateness, efficiency, effectiveness, and timeliness. 
  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the key functions. 



Job Functions


1) Assist the physician and mid-level providers with office practice.

2) Prepare for patient appointments by obtaining required information such as lab results, results of radiological procedures, medical records, and other information as required. 


3) Assist Medical providers during outpatient surgical procedures and treatments:

  • Writing orders and completing consent forms as needed for procedures and treatment
  • Ordering supplies and equipment needed for each specialist procedures
  • Maintaining a sterile environment during the outpatient procedure
  • Assisting the physicians during the outpatient surgeries including invasive procedures
  • Monitoring the patient during the treatment and procedures and providing nursing care as needed
  • Assist with specimen collection and appropriate laboatory techniques to complete diagnostic tests


4) Schedule procedures and treatments the physician orders including CT scans, MRI, surgeries, or other procedures. 


5) Maintains records, reports, logs and statistics as required. 

6) Prepares equipment & instruments for sterilization according to policy.

7) Demonstrates and maintains current knowledge of medication and administers them according to policy and procedures including various injections. Maintains adequate stock of medications and orders needed. 


8) Follows procedures when distributing samples, calling in prescriptions and obtaining physician approval on refills.


9) Maintains a safe environment for patients, customers, self and other employees.

10) Adheres to clinic dress code, wearing your name badge. Identify yourself to patients and customers on the phone and in person. Responds to phone calls and messages in a timely manner.


11) Participates in the review/revision of nursing policies, procedures, standards of patient care and standards of nursing practices.


12) Attends necessary meetings on times and takes responsibility for the content if absent. Maintains professional growth and participates in additional training as needed.



13) Consistently presents a professional image and a caring attitude.

14) Provides safe and effective nursing care to patients through the use of the nursing process.

15) Exercises appropriate judgement and correct techniques in the performance of procedures, treatments, and drug administration.


16) Utilizes measures to promote patient, visitor, and personnel safety.

17) Demonstrates knowledge of disaster/emergency procedures and responds appropriately in emergency situations.



18) Participates in other assigned duties as designated by the Nursing Supervisor/Clinic Manager including referrals, pre-authorizations, pre-certifications are obtained for all patients evaluated at, or referred from the clinic. 




ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Seek out external resources through conferences, workshops, etc. as necessary. 
  • Share professional knowledge with hospital staff, board members, and administrator.
  • Comply with HIPAA regulatory requirements. 
  • Adhere to the companies/facilities philosophy, mission, and policies and procedures.
  • Support the facility goals and objectives.
  • Maintains a good attendance record and follows all hospital rules, policies and procedures.
  • Maintains open and effective communications with patients and their nurses, physicians, peers, supervisors, and students. Establishes and maintains excellent interdepartmental and interpersonal relationships.
  • Attends departmental meetings and in-services to stay current with the developments of the department and hospital.
  • Observes that proper safety measures are enforced in the techniques used on patients receiving therapy. Maintains high safety standards in the facility.
jobs.requirements:
POSITION QUALIFICATIONS


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • ACLS and BLS required upon hire.
  • PALS required within 90-days of employment 
  • Demonstrates initiative, ability to work with others, and professional judgement.  



EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE 

  • Knowledge of theory, principles, techniques, and practice of professional nursing; of scientific principles and nursing research; of preparation, administration, and action of medications; of treatments and medical procedures; of counseling and teaching techniques; of medical equipment as it relates to patient care.  
  • Ability to operate and handle many kinds of complex equipment.   
  • Ability to demonstrate clinical competence and maintain current knowledge in caring for pediatric through geriatric patients. 
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing. 
  • **Required educational levels call for proof at time of hire.
  • 2 years previous clinic experience preferred.


LICENSURE/CERTIFICATION

  • Licensed as an LPN in the state 
  • BLS and ACLS required upon hire
  • PALS required within 90-days of employment
  • *Proof of all required License(s) and Certification(s) is due at time of hire.


LANGUAGE SKILLS

  • English is the primary language 
  • Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures or governmental regulations. 
  • Ability to interpret reports, business correspondence, and policy/procedure manuals. 
  • Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, physicians, clients, customers, employees, and the public. 


MATHEMATICAL SKILLS

  • Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals.  
  • Ability to compute ratio, percent, rate, as well as the ability to create and interpret graphs. 


REASONING ABILITY 

  • Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instruction furnished in written, oral, and/or diagram form.  
  • Ability to define and solve problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. 
  • Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in statistical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. 

INTERPERSONAL SKILLS

  • Demonstrates active listening techniques.
  • Gains support through effective relationships.
  • Treats others with dignity and respect; seeks feedback. 
  • Demonstrates honesty and integrity at all times in care and use of patient and hospital property. 
  • Demonstrates and understands the importance of and respect for the rights, dignity and individuality of each patient in all interactions. 
  • Demonstrates respect for co-workers and responds to the needs of patients by complying with hospital policies.

jobs.title: HOUSE SHIFT SUPERVISOR
jobs.description:
POSITION SUMMARY 

The House Shift Supervisor is responsible for the direct and indirect nursing care of all patients experiencing medically complex conditions, and with rehabilitation and/or wound care needs. He/she is also responsible for the overall direction and supervision of all nursing department personnel during his/her shift. Demonstrates the knowledge and skill to carry out the nursing process when providing care, treatment and services to patients. Satisfies the established standards of the nursing practice, supervises, delegates, and coordinates personnel assigned to the unit and patient care. Supervises the interdisciplinary value-focused care management system and assessed outcomes. Teamwork is promoted between physicians and personnel of other departments.

.


Position Summary Expanded:


Under the Oklahoma Medical Marijuana and Patient Protection Act, (“The Unity Bill”) this position is considered a “Safety-sensitive position. “Safety-sensitive” is defined to include “any job that includes tasks or duties that could affect the safety and health of the employee performing the task or others.” Employees working in “safety-sensitive” roles are subject to this exception and subject to disciplinary action in the event of a positive test for marijuana or its metabolites.



SUPERVISOR

  • CCO


POSITION SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

Supervisory Positions may include:


0 Registered Nurse 0 License Vocational Nurse or Licensed Practical Nurse

0 Certified Nursing Assistant 0 Nurse Technician

0 Monitor Tech 0 Unit Secretary.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each key function satisfactorily.
  • Each category will be assessed on performance measurements of appropriateness, efficiency, effectiveness, and timeliness. 
  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the key functions. 








Job Function

Supervises, coordinates and delegates the delivery of care, treatment and services provided by selected members of the healthcare team. Assesses the value risks, (clinical, perceptual and financial), to minimize the potential impact.  

Communicates directly with patients, families, medical staff, nursing staff, interdisciplinary team members and department heads to coordinate care, treatment and services, improve organization and implementation of patient care to maintain quality of care. Evaluates patient outcomes and revises plan according to changes in patient needs.  

Conducts performance improvement activities to monitor performance and to continuously improve quality. Participates in gathering and analyzing data for trends and to institute actions to resolve problems promptly.

Develops a comprehensive plan of care and discharge plan based on the nursing assessment and integration of the medical plan utilizing patient’s family and other health care tam members. Communicates effectively and appropriate to patient, family and other health care providers.

Assess patient’s condition, learning needs and family dynamics based on systematic data collection utilizing assessment skills and tools appropriate to the respective practice area. 

Document timely and accurately the delivery of health care and nursing process in accordance with specific unit standards and hospital nursing policy. 

Maintains clinical competency (to include age specific) by assuming responsib8ilty for acquiring knowledge and experiences and integrate, as appropriate, into patient care delivery based upon specific patient needs. 

Participates in orientation and education of personnel and students

Access to Pharmacy after hours as required by law. Access limited to following safeguards: 1)successfully completed training and competency provided by Pharmacist 2)access is limited to a set of medications approved by MEC 3) Obtain two (2) signatures upon entry; a pharmacist and an RN and 4) Pharmacist will be available 24 hours a day to answer questions or review medications.   


ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Ability to carry out the essential functions of this job (with or without reasonable accommodation).
  • Access continuing education opportunities appropriate to responsibilities.
  • Accountable for leadership of staff as assigned, delegating and coordinating nursing care to achieve and measure quality, cost-effective outcomes
  • Checks emergency equipment 
  • Demonstrates competency in operation of critical care equipment
  • Demonstrates critical thinking skills 
  • Demonstrates procedures related to the use of nursing equipment and supplies.
  • Demonstrates respect for co-workers and responds to needs of patients by complying with hospital policies.
  • Knows the rationale for the effect of medications and treatments and correctly administer same.
  • Maintains a safe and effective environment.
  • Makes patient rounds to assess physical and emotional status and to initiate nursing intervention.
  • Obtains report from nurse being relieved from duty and provides report to nurse coming on duty. Keeps Nursing Unit manager or others as appropriate informed about patient’s status and related matters. Performs or supervises complete, timely, and accurate documentation of patient care.
  • Performs or supervises administration and documentation of medications, internal nutrition and treatments per physician’s order and accurately records all care provided.
  • Performs or supervises review of medication and treatment records for completeness, accuracy in transcription of physician orders and adherence to stop order policy.
  • Responds to patient and family concern, ensures that each concern is documented and a resolution is initiated. 
  • Responsible for planning, organizing and evaluating care interventions and their effect on outcome
  • Seeks out external resources through conferences, workshops, etc. as necessary. Shares professional knowledge with staff, managers and hospital personnel 
  • Supports staff, patient and family education to enhance knowledge, skills, and necessary behaviors to facilitate positive outcomes.  
  • Utilizes the nursing process, documentation, communication and technical skills, collaboration with physicians and other team members to meet performance requirements
  • Promote the philosophy, mission and objectives of the Company within and to customers outside the hospital.
  • Demonstrates satisfactory level of interpersonal skills to interact with facility and medical staff and Administration, patients, families customers, vendors and government agencies.
  • Assure participation in relevant in-service training sessions, facility meetings and continuing educational opportunities appropriate to responsibilities.   
  • Demonstrates honesty and integrity at all times in care and use of patient and hospital property.
  • Demonstrates ability to prioritize tasks/responsibilities and compete duties within allotted time.  
  • Appropriately accesses the resources of the company’s corporate offices for consultation and program development support. Seeks out external resources through conferences, workshops, etc. as necessary. Shares professional knowledge with staff, directors, managers and hospital personnel.
  • Participate in hospital wide patient safety program identifying risks to patient safety and reducing healthcare errors.
  • Comply with HIPAA regulatory requirements. 
  • Perform other duties as assigned
jobs.requirements:
POSITION QUALIFICATIONS


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Ability to project a Professional Image.
  • Knowledge of regulatory standards, compliance requirements and hospital policies and procedures.
  • Working knowledge and ability to apply professional standards of practice in job situations.
  • Strong organizational and analytical skills.
  • Working knowledge of computer and software applications used in job functions. (Order entry, data entry).
  • Persons who have been found guilty by a court of law of abusing, neglecting, or mistreating individuals in a health care related setting are ineligible for employment in this position.
  • Freedom from illegal use of drugs.
  • Freedom from use of and effects of use of drugs and alcohol in the workplace


EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE 

  • Graduate from an accredited school of professional nursing.   
  • Prefer a Registered Nurse with supervisory experience in long-term acute care or geriatric nursing. Two or more years’ experience as a RN in acute care is preferred.  
  • Completed competency for entry into Drug Room after hours


LICENSURE/CERTIFICATION

  • Registered Nurse who is currently licensed to practice, in good standing, by the state of employment.  
  • BLS, PALS and ACLS required upon hire certifications 
  • *Proof of all required License(s) and Certification(s) is due at time of hire.


LANGUAGE SKILLS

  • English is the primary language 
  • Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures or governmental regulations. 
  • Ability to interpret and write reports, business correspondence, and policy/procedure manuals. 
  • Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, physicians, clients, customers, employees, the board and the public. 


MATHEMATICAL SKILLS

  • Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals.  
  • Ability to compute ratio, percent, rate, as well as the ability to create and interpret graphs. 


REASONING ABILITY 

  • Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instruction furnished in written, oral, and/or diagram form.  
  • Ability to define and solve problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. 
  • Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in statistical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. 

INTERPERSONAL SKILLS

  • Demonstrates active listening techniques.
  • Gains support through effective relationships.
  • Treats others with dignity and respect; seeks feedback. 
  • Demonstrates honesty and integrity at all times in care and use of patient and hospital property. 
  • Demonstrates and understands the importance of and respect for the rights, dignity and individuality of each patient in all interactions. 
  • Demonstrates respect for co-workers and responds to the needs of patients by complying with hospital policies.

jobs.title: CERTIFIED NURSE ASSISTANT
jobs.description:
POSITION SUMMARY 

Assist licensed nursing personnel in providing patient care in assigned areas. Helps patients by supporting personal hygiene and daily living needs; providing comfort, transportation, and vital sign monitoring.


Position Summary Expanded:


Under the Oklahoma Medical Marijuana and Patient Protection Act, (“The Unity Bill”) this position is considered a “Safety-sensitive position. “Safety-sensitive” is defined to include “any job that includes tasks or duties that could affect the safety and health of the employee performing the task or others.” Employees working in “safety-sensitive” roles are subject to this exception and subject to disciplinary action in the event of a positive test for marijuana or its metabolites.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each key function satisfactorily.
  • Each category will be assessed on performance measurements of appropriateness, efficiency, effectiveness, and timeliness. 
  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the key functions. 



Job Functions


1) Responsible for feeding patients (some patients will require direct feeding, while others may just need their meal tray brought to them and set up).


2) Provides oral care, nail care and basic hygiene for patients. 

3) Responsible for bathing and dressing of patients. Bathing may take the place in the form of a bed bath, shower, or tub. 


4) Responsible for helping patients to the restroom when needed. Often patients will need help moving on and off the toilet or bed pan. 


5) Changing of catheter bags and charting amounts

6) Blood pressure, pulse, pulse oximetry, and temperature monitoring of patients. 

7) Answering call lights.

8) Turning of bedridden patients. This is done to take the weight off of pressure points and prevent bedsores from occurring.


9) Changing bedding and collecting soiled laundry.

10) Light cleaning and organizing of patient room or area.

11) Relaying and charting requested information. This may include moods, vital signs, meal consumption, liquid intake, and daily bowel movement and urine amounts. 


12) Relaying information to the next CNA on shift, or to the nurses in charge.

13) Recreational activities, such as assisting with a walk outdoors or delivering reading material to patients. 


14) Post mortem care. 

15) Provides safe and effective nursing care rendered directly or indirectly. 

16) Courteous to all members of the hospital staff.

17) Communicates with all members of the healthcare team. 

18) Certified to perform cardio-pulmonary resuscitation (CPR) and be knowledgeable of all critical access hospital emergency protocols. (OHA 310:667-39-9 e.7)


19) Perform other duties as assigned. 


ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Comply with HIPAA regulatory requirements. 
  • Adhere to the companies/facilities philosophy, mission, and policies and procedures.
  • Support the facility goals and objectives.
  • Maintains a good attendance record and follows all hospital rules, policies and procedures.
  • Maintains open and effective communications with patients and their nurses, physicians, peers, supervisors, and students. Establishes and maintains excellent interdepartmental and interpersonal relationships.
  • Attends departmental meetings and in-services to stay current with the developments of the department and hospital.
  • Observes that proper safety measures are enforced in the techniques used on patients receiving therapy. Maintains high safety standards in the facility.
